data.message: THANK YOU MATT! people can learn from your comment. so sick of these myths, it makes me ill.
true
the article said it was a Bull Mastiff
Lies
Matt i disagree my dad told me his friend had a pitt that was never abused but it turned on him and attacked him

You people are retarded. It was 1/2 Pitbull and 1/2 Bull Mastiff and look at the deaths caused by dogs since 2000 to 2013. Other than a doberman or lab or german shepard on occasion, the list contains 98% of deaths to humans by Pitbull or Pitbull mix. I wish some of you would get attacked by a pitbull so I can watch you while being attacked say "poor doggy, it's not your fault. It's your masters fault." Pfffft
Well said Jarrod!

yes, owners should be blamed, not the dog. If you take care of your dog and have them properly trained, they won't attack people. Also, dogs have instincts that tend to protect their owners when they are in danger. Responsible ownership.
I guess all owners are training pit bulls to be bad because all you hear about pit bulls is them mauling someone.

Pitbut have a killer instints like a wolf, that is why they are used for fighting, they fight to kill, other dogs even when they fight they do not fight to kill that is why they are not used for that purpose, and as a wolf instinct dog they do not like children because thay feel jealous of not becoming the next in charge, I know you all watch the Lion King, remember the brother lion trying to kill the baby lion why, because the baby lion is next in charge, it is their instinct,
any dog can turn...and this dog did it because it felt it's master was threatened...this dog probably didn't understand kids.
their master
PS it wasn't a pitbull

All dogs are descendants of wolfs, a dog properly trained will not attack someone unless told to and if you don't believe that you do not know how to train a dog. 100% responsibility of dog owner, in my mind they should get murder charges!
If the dog doesn't understand kids it should not be around them! Again 100% owners fault! You can NOT blame the breed only the bad owner!!
they may not be evil, but their sheer strength should be considered when around small children.  The dog may just be playing but jaw power is fatal

I LOVE reading all the comments by people who heard from a person who heard from a person about a person, blah blah blah.  Those comments just make the commentors looks STUPID.  ALL but one of the Vick dogs, were adopted out, FIVE have become therapy dogs.  Tired of hearing idiots spew their bull about pit bulls.  They wouldnt know one if they ran into one.  There are 20 breeds of dogs that look like the public perception of a pit.  Looks dont define the breed.
http://www.salon.com/2007/08/20/pit_bulls/
http://www.truecrimereport.com/2011/08/darla_napora_pregnant_pit_bull.php

I have a 6 month old red noise pit & loves my kids , wife & family. But if he ever bites anyone of them or anyone else I would be the one to put him down.  What some poeple don't understand is if you are going to own a pitt bull you have to give them more attenion then what you would with any other dog.  If you are a pittbull owner you have to beware of the dog at all times & let people know about the good thing the pittbull do like did you know 20% of all k9 cops have pittbulls. but if you are going to tell people about the good you need to tell people about the bad as well. Its is very sad about what happen to the little boy no parent should ever go through this. My heart goes out to his family.
Learn how to train a dog bottom line!

How about parents be more responsible and stop leaving your children unattended in ANY situation..... I have a Pitt/Terrier kids ride him lol pull on him,play with him, he has never raised a paw or showed his teeth...he loves children, and cats lol..its the squirrels in my backyard that gotta watch out!
How about people stop training dogs to be that way.  It has nothing to do with breed.

if you are a dog owner,especially of a large breed, you should be aware that when you train them, they should be associated with babies and children. Dogs are protective in nature and screaming kids and crying babies could be potential signs for animals to be protective of their owners.Also, sounds that are unfamiliar to them would cause them irritation which makes them agitated and therefore attacking the one making the noise. Owners should be the one responsible for their dogs and not allow the dogs to guard babies as their own security.
The only thing Michael Vick did wrong was abuse the animals first. Kill them who cares, fight them who cares, but abusing them first is sick lol
